div.span: and so, kitty came to hang out with me for a while because she couldn't go out in the rain and spent like half an hour purring and walking all over me and then left out the door to go to the living room to see if it didn't rain on the other side of the house (sliding door, back yard) but it did so she came back and i got up and she led me to the living room and we hung out on the backyard steps for a while looking at the rain, and then romie joined
and so three of us just silently hung out for a while at four in the morning as it poured outside
and then i had a lucid dream

message.div: you had a lucid dream in your lucid dream?

div.span: i just woke up in the middle of the night and had this strange gathering of animals and then went back to sleep and had a lucid dream
this house is weird — there's all sort of magical weirdness that goes on at night
one time in the summer, when i first moved here and was still staying in the cabin, i woke up because of all the wind and my kis was awake too
so we walked into the backyard and everything was so windy and moaning and chiming (wind chimes) and it was so bright because the moon was full and there aren't too many lights at night here
and it was like, starkly beautiful
there's a cypress tree in the back yard that was blowing in the wind
looked like a van gogh painting
kis and i just stood around there for a while looking at all of it
at like 3 or 4 in the morning

message.div: so how did you like lucid dreaming?

div.span: it felt like very light sleep
i mean, i even thought maybe i'm just closing my eyes and imagining everything but my imagination isn't that good — everything was too real
but it's pretty much gone from my head right now, too, like a real dream

message.div: A lot of your ordinary dreams will have objects or people in them that could act as a cue to you waking up in your dreams. For example if you regularly talk to ‘Elvis’ in your ordinary dreams this is an obvious dream sign and can be used to ask yourself if you are dreaming because you know Elvis is dead
i think the dream journal probably helps with that
you also have the first one down
but i don't remember ANY dreams
I think I have to fix this _maybe_ sleep problem
we used to call Jacob the world's loneliest whale
and he would make whale noises
the rest are a little fluffy

div.span: Each night before drifting off to sleep repeat the phrase ‘I will remember my dreams as soon as I wake up’.
just do a weird chant before you sleep every night

message.div: well I keep tottering between thinking i have a sleep problem and not
yesterday I think i teetered into thinking that I may have had one for a while
cause I can normally sleep until 1-3pm
so I was entertaining the notion that perhaps I don't get good sleep normally and usually sleep longer

div.span: maybe you just need more sleep

message.div: i don't think people need that much sleep usually!

div.span: people need varying amounts of sleep
but maybe you're right and your body is trying to compensate for something
you should do the sleep study!

message.div: lets try to do lucid dreaming!
don't worry if I can't do it!
I was kind of thinking about blackoutblackfriday
and decided to go to radioshack and make a return
wasn't sure if that was entirely in like with the idea, but I figured it was okay

div.span: how was it looking over there?

message.div: but i just checked it and i think there were a bunch of arrests in Union Sq.

PROTESTS HALT SAN FRANCISCO TRAIN LINE
In Oakland, a "Black Lives Matter" protest snarled the San Francisco Bay Area Regional Transit system after about two dozen of the 100 demonstrators chained themselves to train cars at the West Oakland station.

Protests in San Francisco started downtown, converging on the shopping area of Union Square, where demonstrators attempted to disrupt the tree-lighting ceremony. It then wound down to the Mission district. An Apple Store, a Bank of America location and a news van were vandalized during the protests, and a RadioShack was broken into. Police were out in riot gear.

div.span: that is so different from what was reported on tv here
but then maybe it's because i saw the report on the earlier side?

message.div: also it's pretty cool that it hit USA today
and a couple other big ones
cnn didn't make google's top-ten but it's up there

div.span: cnn has been a piece of shit in reporting on ferguson
but glad this is making the rounds nontheless
hey there's a story on gawker by kiese laymon, a writer and prof at vassar http://gawker.com/my-vassar-college-faculty-id-makes-everything-ok-1664133077

message.div: he used to live in my dowm

div.span: he's fantastic, i've read his writings before and listened to his stories

message.div: haha — no, he was just a professor that lived in the dorm
ah i think it may have been
they had a thing going on together that they tried to hide from their students : )

div.span: the body they found after ferguson protests inside of the car is the body of a witness to the mike brown shooting
he'd been set on fire and shot
in much better news: "Ferguson Protesters Chain Mall Doors Shut In Seattle"
aaaand that's it for ferguson for me today

message.div: I'm out for the next 5 hours
taking final exams for my data mining class
totally torn to shreds in these exams
i don't get the results until monday
if so, then probably just barely

div.span: but i'm sure you did great

message.div: i take that as a yes
amongst the not-so-great search of "good luck" in giphy
IT WAS BETTER THAN TEENAGE THE TEENAGE GIRL BIRTHDAY GIFS
UGH PERSON WHO IS CHECKING OUT THE ROOMS IS SO STRANGE!
there's someone looking at Thomas and my rooms*

div.span: i got in trouble on facebook
i don't know if you can see it?
i guess i just didn't come at it from a condescending perspective but i could totally see how it would come off as that

message.div: i don't think that was wrong, what you said
it sounds like you just want to help, but then found someone who had thought it out a little more than yourself
nothing wrong with that, it's just a little embarrasing
cause it always makes you feel silly
but i don't think that means that you came in it from a
you know what would be pretty cool — thinking about it from a technology perspective
where people can write up any problems they had with officers.
there are all kinds of subtle, non-technical problems building it
and the face that it would only be a negative site
but it's also a two-weekend project

div.span: i think i saw something like that before maybe
but, a ratings system like yelp

message.div: I'm not sure it would be fantastic
i think there's a better idea, right around the corner of it
naw — it can get pretty bad

div.span: it'd open the floodgates to slander, really quickly

message.div: the issue is that it's an inherently negative website

div.span: what if it was police headquarter centered

message.div: the problem isn't with the idea of rating
it's more the fact that a police officer's job is just inherently negative
well, when you interact with them

div.span: they just abuse it to no end

message.div: yes — something like this would be an inherently good thing
however the tricky thing about it is the same as any rating site faces
and the fact that if it is mostly negative, no one will want to use it anyways
is to, perhaps, bucket in "share your experience" version
maybe something like a "know your rights" website
or a way to get quick access to others when you are in a bind
then, from that, you can pull out the police reports
and, perhaps, link them to tickets
which gives credibility to any report
of course all of these have to start with the first feature and that can be any of these: rating site included

div.span: heated debate with mom about minimum wage
"they don't have to work in minimum wage, they can find better jobs!"
hey would you be able to come get me
i know it's like the last thing you want to do
can i call you in a bit
i'm going for a walk with anna
went on walk, talked to sis, calmed down
came back all ready to apologize to mom for the tone of voice etc etc
turns out she was all this while researching the topic and coming up with more ammo
i left the conversation, anna's handling it
it's really hard to hear the parents talk about such dumb shit

message.div: sorry you have to go through that

div.span: i desperately need to go through nonviolent communication resources
......can't really order from amazon for another couple of days though
sammmm i want to see you
i feel like it's been forever

message.div: you'll come back and be a different person
I'll be wearing a cap and gown that coursera'll have sent me
you can find half of the book here

div.span: maybe it'll drown out the noise of my mom and sister arguing

message.div: it's narrated by the guy as well
oh my god it's amazing though

div.span: it's like a cup of really good tea

message.div: about the app idea that we were talking about
i think it's pretty poor form to build something like that without talking to people about it
so we should talk through it more and then I'll email Kiese and see what he thinks

div.span: i need to read what you wrote before
yes always important to do something that's actually useful and do research and talk to people about things and not come into anything from a totally disconnected perspective
the ratings thing would never work
the difference between a police officer and a restaurant (one of many, to be sure) is that you can choose your restaurant but you're often shit out of luck with your police officer
what i know that's missing out there is people knowing their rights
so maybe that's something that needs to be addressed, instead
but i'm not actually sure about how you'd turn that into an app, or whatever
but something like, you know those bike cards we got in portland?
except, the whole problem here is with such a militarized police force knowing rights doesn't really matter
you can be shot in the back when you're handcuffed
smothered to death with a pillow as you're lying face down on your bed
killed for looking like a threatening 12 year old instead of an unthreatening one
i think if we were to talk to organizers in a community or organization working against all of that, and ask what can we do with our skills, how can we contribute
maybe we'd get a better sense?

message.div: that doesn't mean that there isn't anything wrong with coming up with ideas from an outside perspective
you just have to assume it will all be wrong
safety bracelet! just a bracelet that can quickly record audio

div.span: something that can alert your friends to your location if you press it or something

message.div: haha, it's kind of like those silver hospital bands but for racism

div.span: like a neighborhood watch activation thing but against brutal police
we should think up of more!

message.div: i'm really just thinking about the scenarios in Kiese's article

div.span: have you seen that thing about that one city that tricked the kkk members to march for charity?
ugh i hate rt but can't find another source right now
hey i think the thing with the bracelets or the audio recording thing
you know like those robots that "patrol" some parking lots in cupertino or whatever?
the main thing they do is that they stream live video
what if we figured out a way to stream something live to an online board

message.div: well — how often would you want to have this thing running?

div.span: but the idea is, if the system doesn't work
maybe it's time to make a new system

message.div: this could be something for protests?
let's just put that one on the shelf

div.span: but i do want to talk about figuring out a way to crowd source safety
i think that's something that we should talk about

message.div: so, say you get pulled over by a cop for no reason other than the skin color thing
if you could press a button that would give you something to help you

div.span: remain calm, keep hands on wheel

message.div: but lets say you now have that
and the officer comes over, says something snide, then writes you a $200 ticket for a 'rolling stop' at a stop sign
So rights is a big one, clearly. Especially if you're in real trouble, but I think that small encounters of once-a-month or once-a-week racism would be the bigger battle.

div.span: mom and anna are winding down
i WILL remember my dreams tonight i WILL remember my dreams tonight i will i will i will
